questions.question: Can you describe your experience with Power BI?
questions.answer: I have over 6 years of hands-on experience using Power BI Desktop and Power BI Service. I’ve developed 50+ interactive dashboards across healthcare, insurance, retail, and IT operations, integrating data from SQL Server, Oracle, and APIs using Power Query. I specialize in DAX, RLS, and scalable data modeling.

questions.question: How do you ensure data accuracy in your reports?
questions.answer: I implement validation rules during data transformation, use test datasets to verify DAX measures, and apply visual indicators to highlight anomalies. I also work closely with stakeholders to validate KPIs and build refresh audit logic using Power BI Service and Dataflows.

questions.question: What’s your approach to data modeling in Power BI?
questions.answer: I follow a star schema approach wherever possible, use role-playing dimensions, create calculated tables for hierarchy, and ensure relationships are single-direction unless needed. I optimize with summarization tables and minimize row-level calculations in visuals.

questions.question: Explain Row-Level Security (RLS) and how you’ve used it.
questions.answer: RLS restricts data access based on user roles. At Northside Hospital, I implemented RLS on clinical dashboards so each department could only see its own patients and metrics. I defined roles in Power BI and validated them using the 'View As Role' feature before deployment.

questions.question: How do you handle performance issues in Power BI reports?
questions.answer: I use tools like Performance Analyzer and DAX Studio. I optimize slow visuals by using calculated columns instead of measures when needed, removing unused columns from the data model, avoiding bi-directional relationships, and aggregating data before loading it into Power BI.

questions.question: Have you worked with Power BI Gateways and Dataflows?
questions.answer: Yes. At Manhattan Associates, I configured on-premise gateways to refresh SQL Server data and used Dataflows for shared ETL logic across multiple reports. This setup standardized refresh pipelines and improved maintainability.

questions.question: How do you manage version control with PBIX files?
questions.answer: I use Git to version control datasets and documentation. For PBIX files, I follow a naming convention with timestamps and store release notes in Markdown. I’ve also experimented with breaking reports into dataset and report layers using deployment pipelines in Power BI Service.

questions.question: Describe a dashboard you’re proud of.
questions.answer: At Hiscox Insurance, I built a fraud detection dashboard combining claims data with external trend indicators. It used AI insights, conditional formatting, and layered drill-through filters. The dashboard reduced review time by 60% and surfaced $750K in premium misalignment.

questions.question: How do you stay updated with Power BI features?
questions.answer: I follow Guy in a Cube, SQLBI, and the official Power BI blog. I also test features in the monthly preview updates and share internal demos with my team during knowledge transfer sessions.

questions.question: What do you think makes a great Power BI dashboard?
questions.answer: Clarity, speed, and purpose. A great dashboard should answer business questions in under 5 seconds, have intuitive layout and navigation, and be visually consistent. It must tell a story without requiring user explanation.
